note.p: NOTE: Speaking parts are marked with asteriks**. All except Sojourner Truth may read speeches from rostrum, and even she may read her long sppech, but should learn rest of dialogue. Faunces has only one line. "And I voted."

actiondesc.l: A Narrator comes to the rostrum
and shouts four words very loudly
as if opening a Town Meeting.

dialogue.p: The dictionary says: "Ballot--- the method of secret voting; originally by means of small balls placed in an urn or box." "Suffrage--- a vote given by a member of a body, state, or society, in assent to a proposition or in favor of the election of a person." "Franchise--- the right of voting at public elections." "Vote--- an intimation that one approves or disapproves, accepts or rejects, a proposal, motion, candidate for office, or the like."
